GD160.name: Digital Graphic Design: Tools and Methods
GD160.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
GD160.description: Introduction of digital tools and methods specific to contemporary graphic design.

GD200.name: History of Graphic Design
GD200.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
GD200.description: Survey of visual communication. Social, global and technological developments in graphic design as it relates to art historical movements and other design disciplines. Typography of printed and digital work from 1880 to present.

GD260.name: Concepts of Graphic Design
GD260.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GD260.description: Overview of form and communication analysis and manipulation. Investigation of theory, concept and visual tools central to developing visual communication systems.
GD260.restrictions: Not open to students in the Graphic Design Major.

GD295.name: Design Thinking for Entrepreneurs
GD295.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GD295.description: Skills in ideation and innovation, discovering human needs and matching them with feasible solutions developed in accordance with the principles and practices of entrepreneurship; creating value and working towards social good by developing solutions to complex issues affecting multiple systems or populations.
GD295.restrictions: Open to students in the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Minor.

GD303.name: Experimental Design Practices
GD303.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD303.description: Studio-based survey of experimental and futures-oriented design practices that are interdisciplinary in nature, intersect with emergent practices in the visual arts, and address broader issues of power, normativity, and social justice.
GD303.restrictions: Open to students in the Experience Architecture Major or in the Graphic Design Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art or in the Studio Art Major.

GD360.name: Graphic Design I: Graphic Form
GD360.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD360.description: Introduction to form analysis and manipulation, through theory, concept and visual tools, to develop clear formal languages. Traditional and digital craft. Development of verbal articulation.
GD360.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 113 and STA 114 and STA 112

GD365.name: Typography I: Form and Meaning
GD365.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD365.description: Formal and communicative properties of typography. Letterform, font specification, style, meaning, texture, and space. Sequence of analysis from formal aspects, to communicative, to a synthesis of the two.
GD365.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 113 and STA 114 and STA 112

GD460.name: Graphic Design II: Visual Communication
GD460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD460.description: Advance from the analysis of form to the meaning of form. Synthesis of form and content will progress towards cohesive communication systems.

GD462.name: Spatial Design
GD462.description: Development and application of visual communication elements for volumetric structures and spaces.

GD465.name: Typography II: Typographic Systems
GD465.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD465.description: Typographic exploration through grid, hierarchy, and systems development. Variety of purpose, content and viewer consideration in resulting appropriate forms.

GD466.name: Identity Design
GD466.description: Design development, hierarchical unification, and application strategies for the graphic identification of organizations and sub-units of organizations.

GD467.name: Motion Design
GD467.description: Time-based design utilizing sound and motion for visual communication and personal expression relating to the field of graphic design. Conceptual and formal explorations relating to the moving image such as motion graphics, stop-motion animation, and kinetic typography.

GD468.name: Interaction Design
GD468.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD468.description: Digital interactivity as a tool for visual communication, design and distribution of ideas. Conceptual, formal and typographical explorations relating to screen-based activities such as interface design, user-interaction and basic animation.

GD490.name: Independent Study
GD490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

GD491.name: Selected Topics - Graphic Design
GD491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GD491.description: Experimental and relevant topics of interest in graphic design.

GD492.name: Senior Seminar and Professional Practice (W)
GD492.description: Capstone course for graphic designers. Writing as a mode of issue delineation and definition, portfolio preparation.
GD492.prerequisite: (STA 492A or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
GD492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Graphic Design Major.

GD492A.name: Exhibition Practicum
GD492A.description: Exhibition experience in graphic design. Audience delineation, conceptual framing, use of space, and evaluation.
GD492A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
GD492A.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Graphic Design Major.

GD493.name: Graphic Design Internship
GD493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GD493.description: Field experience in a working design environment under supervision of a graphic design professional.

GD494.name: Design Center
GD494.description: Practicum in design problem-solving, including extensive contact with selected clients at a professional level.
